string-array.name: attribution_titles
string-array.item: TileView
Lingver
Simple-XML
Swipe-Selector
FloatingActionButton
TapTargetView
Google Support Libraries
Exo Bold
Ikony

string-array.name: attribution_descriptions
string-array.item:
TileView asynchronously displays tile-based images, with pan and zoom functionality, and supports features like markers, hotspots, paths, multiple levels of detail, and arbitrary coordinate systems. 

Version: com.qozix:tileview:2.2.6 
Author: Mike Dunn 
License: MIT 
Site: https://github.com/moagrius/TileView

Lingver is a library to manage your application locale and language. 

Version: com.github.YarikSOffice:lingver:1.1.0 
Author: Yaroslav Berezanskyi 
License: MIT 
Site: https://github.com/YarikSOffice/lingver

Simple is a high performance XML serialization and configuration framework for Java. It offers full object serialization and deserialization, maintaining each reference encountered. 

Version: org.simpleframework:simple-xml:2.7.1 
Author: Niall Gallagher 
License: Apache 2.0 
Site: http://simple.sourceforge.net/

A nicer-looking, more intuitive and highly customizable alternative for radio buttons and dropdowns for Android. This view is based on Swipe-Selector. 

Version: com.roughike:swipe-selector:1.0.6 
Author: Iiro Krankka 
License: Apache 2.0 
Site: https://github.com/roughike/SwipeSelector

Yet another implementation of Floating Action Button for Android with lots of features. 

Version: com.github.clans:fab:1.6.4 
Author: Dmytro Tarianyk 
License: Apache 2.0 
Site: https://github.com/Clans/FloatingActionButton

An implementation of tap targets from Google's Material Design guidelines on feature discovery. 

Version: com.getkeepsafe.taptargetview:taptargetview:1.9.1 
Author: Keepsafe Software Inc. 
License: Apache 2.0 
Site: https://github.com/KeepSafe/TapTargetView

A group of support libraries offering backward compatibility and convenient helper classes. 

Version: com.android.support 
Author: The Android Open Source Project 
License: Apache 2.0 
Site: https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/support-library/index.html

A Sans Serif font used for displaying names on the map. 

Version: Exo Bold 
Author: Natanael Gama (exo@ndiscovered.com) 
License: SIL Open Font License v1.10 
Site: https://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/exo

Icons generated thanks to Austin Andrews - https://materialdesignicons.com/ 
Credits: Google Inc. 
License: Apache 2.0 
Site: https://github.com/google/material-design-icons

Map tiles, also available at project site accessible through launcher icon at the top. 

Map tiles by Stamen Design, under CC BY 3.0.
